HeadingParagraphs: Hello! Thank you for visiting. My name is Reed Spratt, and I primarily work in software and games development.

WrappedParagraphs: My work is primarily based in programming and systems design, but I also enjoy UI and level design. My current focus for new projects is based in games research and programming.
I have been programming professionally and independently since 2016. My most proficient languages in-order of experience are: C, Lua, Python, JavaScript, C#, and C++.

My game engine of choice for development is Roblox Studio. I have spent just over thirteen years using the Roblox platform and four years there programming. More recently, I have been working in Unity for the creation of games and custom editor tools for development.

FooterParagraphs: A selection of my past works can be found by using the navigation links at the top-right of the page.

HeadingParagraphs: I am currently employed at the Roblox experience development company SuperSocial as a QA Tester.
I have contributed to thirteen games with brand collaborations including: Fairview Portals, Gucci, NARS Cosmetics, Tokido and Walmart.

Items: Devising and executing test strategies for new brand experiences.
Conducting performance testing in development and live testing.
Communicating issues to other development teams after reporting.
Participating in and helping to lead coordinated team-wide test sessions.
Assisting the QA lead in configuring QA workflows and tools for use.

HeadingParagraphs: Worked as a QA tester in a volunteer capacity for the company MELON.
During my time here, I contributed to branded experiences including

Items: Performed exploratory and guided testing for upcoming games.
Provided feedback regarding UX and overall game design and feel.
Assisted engineering in debugging performance issues.

HeadingParagraphs: I attended the University of Guelph majoring in Software Engineering, and minoring in Music.
During my time here, I participated in seven team-based software projects while studying and practicing agile development methodologies.
I attended Western University to study advanced topics and complete research. I majored in Computer Science.
My specializations included: music recommender systems, character AI for games, relational databases, and unstructured data processing.

Items: Designing Hybrid AI Frameworks for Believable Character Behaviours
Building Editor Tools to Streamline Development for Non-Programmers

HeadingParagraphs: The basis of my work and much of my research in game design and development stems from the games I grew up with.
